_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Executive Summary



EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

Taylor Farms, Maryland, Inc. ? Annapolis Junction Facility



General



Taylor Farms, Inc. ? Annapolis Junction Facility is a fresh produce packaging facility that packages various perishable products. Therefore, a refrigeration system is required to maintain product temperatures. The refrigerant chosen to accomplish this is anhydrous ammonia. While recognizing the hazards of ammonia, Taylor Farms, Inc. ? Annapolis Junction Facility strives to maintain the safest refrigeration system possible in order to protect employees, neighbors and the environment. 



1.0    Identification of Covered Process ? Taylor Farms, Inc. ? Annapolis Junction Facility employs anhydrous ammonia as the refrigerant to chill process water and maintain temperatures in the cold storage section of the plant as well as production areas. The overall plant charge is in excess of 10,000 Lbs., therefore, the OSHA Process Safety Management and EPA List Rule Applies.



2.0    Program Level - The ammonia refrigeration system falls under the Program 3 guidelines.



3.0    Management of Change - The management personnel with overall responsibility for the program is the Maintenance Manager.



4.0    Hazard Assessment - A hazard analysis has been performed on the Ammonia Refrigeration system. 

Three portions are included in this assessment.

4.1   Worst Case Scenario ? The worst Case Scenario, as defined by the EPA; ?the owner/operator shall assume that the maximum quantity in the largest vessel is released as a gas over 10 minutes, due to an unspecified failure.?  Atmospheric dispersion modeling has been performed to determine the distance traveled by the anhydrous ammonia before its concentration decreases to the toxic end point of 3 ppm. This level is defined by the American Industrial Hygiene Association (AIHA) as the concentration at which all individuals could be exposed without irreversible or serious health effects that would prevent protective action. As a result

of the worst case evaluation, a radius of 0.2 miles has been determined and an affected residential population of 0. Please refer to the worse case section for specific details.

4.2   Alternative Case Scenario ? The alternative case scenario was performed as above with the exception that the alternative case evaluates the release over 60 minutes. The result of this evaluation was a radius of 0.1 miles with an affected population of 0. Please refer to the alternative case section for specific details.

4.3   Five Year Accident History ? The Taylor Farms, Inc. Annapolis Junction Facility has not experienced a release over the past five years.



5.0    Accident Prevention Program ? Taylor Farms, Inc. ? Annapolis Junction Facility is in full compliance with OSHA Process Safety Management guidelines for the method of Accident Prevention. The Accident Prevention and PSM Programs empha: operator training, preventative maintenance, state of the art equipment, use of accurate operating procedures, hazard reviews of the system, ammonia awareness, proper auditing program and inspection programs.



6.0    Emergency Response Program ? Taylor Farms, Inc. Annapolis Junction Facility utilizes a unified approach in handling emergencies that may arise in regard to the ammonia refrigeration system. All OSHA and EPA guidelines are adhered to and the Local Emergency Planning Commission has been consulted and a comprehensive response plan developed. Taylor Farms, Inc. ? Annapolis Junction Facility does not play an active role in the emergency response, however, personnel have been trained to assist local authorities in responding to an incident. The emergency response plan is reviewed annually and all parties are to be informed of any facility changes.
